intro: Arachnorchis uliginosa, commonly known as the bog orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant thrives in acidic, moist soils and is often found in swampy or heathland environments. Its unique morphology includes a single, narrow leaf and a cluster of tiny, spurred flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
